p: In recent years, researchers are increasingly keen on herbal products for use in daily health care products or as food supplements. Numerous herbs including Psidium guajava (Alias et al., 2015[ 6]), Hibiscus sabdariffa (Akhtar Husin et al., 2017[ 5]) and Zingiber zerumbet (Hamid et al., 2018[ 36]) were reported to exhibit hepatoprotective effects and high antioxidant activity. Given that current evidence suggesting that cisplatin-induced hepatotoxicity is mediated by oxidative stress (Karadeniz et al., 2011[ 44]; Palipoch et al., 2014[ 64]); natural products with antioxidant activity could be used as an alternative treatment to overcome this problem.
